meanings.definition: A simple mattress filled with straw or other material.
meanings.sent1: The old man slept on a palliasse in the corner of the room.
meanings.sent2: The children played and jumped on the palliasse in the backyard.
meanings.sent3: The cat thought the palliasse was a giant scratching post.
meanings.sent4: Her mind felt like a palliasse, stuffed with thoughts and memories.
meanings.sent5: The palliasse was so comfortable, it felt like sleeping on a cloud.

meanings.definition: To stuff or fill with straw or similar material.
meanings.sent1: She decided to palliasse the scarecrow to make it look more realistic.
meanings.sent2: The farmer would palliasse the sacks to keep the grains safe from pests.
meanings.sent3: The kids tried to palliasse the snowman with twigs and leaves.
meanings.sent4: His words seemed to palliasse her heart with warmth and comfort.
meanings.sent5: The chef would palliasse the turkey with herbs and spices before roasting it.
